channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Please clear.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell Church Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuously obstructing the pavement,, 30th July
item.description:
The owners and visitors are obstructing the pavement on a daily basis. We ( residents)have reported them to Council, they had a visit (as they are in breach of Premises Licence as well) but they constantly ignoring the law. They are causing a danger to pedestrians as there is no space to move so they have to walk on the street. Also they are parking the cars on the corner which causing an obstructions to the incoming cars. We have witnessed the conversation with the traffic warden ….” Bro, don’t give us a ticket , just come in and we move the car”… This is not fair on the residents that are paying for the residents permits, not fair on elderly people who must walk on the street, not fair on the disabled people who safely can walk on the street. Please help us we are loosing our minds what happened to our quiet street since they have taken over the premises.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Queen's Avenue, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bushes too high & affecting properties, 30th July
item.description:
Bushes to the left of the main park entrance have become too high & need reducing in height by 4/5 feet, in line with shed roof. They are putting undue pressure of the roof. Can someone contact me to discuss this issue please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Play Ground Close, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins left on road AGAIN., 30th July
item.description:
The bins for Westmoreland Terrace block are left on the road once again, meaning everyone can fill it with their rubbish. There is also flytipping next to it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Terrace, Anerley, London

item.title: Overgrown bushes in front of the building outside 73 St.Johns Court. I have asked the gardeners to cut these as they have always done previously, but they told me they wont unless I raise a complaint. I have seen mice in the bushes and there is an air vent which leads to my kitchen so i am very concerned about rodents coming into my kitchen., 30th July
item.description:
Overgrown bushes in front of the building outside 73 St.Johns Court. I have asked the gardeners to cut these as they have always done previously, but they told me they wont unless I raise a complaint. I have seen mice in the bushes and there is an air vent

item.title: Overflowing rubbish on pavement ALL THE TIME, 30th July
item.description:
I know this issue will be eventually resolved for now but once it will be, it will only happen again. It is constant. Food waste all over the place and the like which people are stepping into. The residents of 4 Red Barracks Road need to be dealt with. It’s an absolute disgrace.

item.title: Overhanging trees, ivy, thorny creepers and climbing plants obstructing the public walkway and street lighting from Hascombe Terrace to Allendale Close., 30th July
item.description:
This was reported under FixMyStreet ref: 7733171 on 19th June and ref: 7763335 on 25th June which you twice have erroneously classified as fixed. Overhanging trees, ivy, thorny creepers and climbing plants from 3 Hascombe Terrace / Love Walk obstructing the public walkway leading from Hascombe Terrace to Allendale Close. This is causing problems OCCLUDING the street lighting lamp 402018 from the Allendale Close end of the public walkway and is a potential TRIP HAZARD with ivy and a nasty thorny creeper creeping out vociferously onto the public walkway. Could you please have the owners of 3 Hascombe Terrace cut back the tree overgrowth and creepers. I am also reporting this to my local Councillor and street lighting so this will be actioned. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58-59, Allendale Close, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
